result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:50 AM Defendant Danielle Lee Boettcher in court.  Attorney David Vernon Penn in court for Danielle Lee Boettcher.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. State/Defense speaks to the case and requesting plea and sentencing to move forward. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:32 AM Defendant Danielle Lee Boettcher in court.  Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Danielle Lee Boettcher.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense confirms receipt of complaint. Waive formal reading. Not guilty pleas entered. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Judge would like scheduling done with parties with JA
Adjourned initial appearance on June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on May 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

*** 50.00 Cash was previously posted***
Court orders a mental health evaluation be conducted prior to release to assess mental health.  Jail must receive written verification from ex-husband that defendant is allowed to reside there, otherwise she must provide an updated address, no contact with D.S.(1944), Maintain absolute sobriety, Take medications as prescribed.  Amended bond form.

Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State elected to not charge on a new matter, however speaks to bond in this case.  Court will be disqualifying from case. Bond conditions amended to: Court orders a mental health evaluation be conducted prior to release to assess mental health.  Jail must receive written verification from ex-husband that defendant is allowed to reside there, otherwise she must provide an updated address, no contact with D.S.(1944), Maintain absolute sobriety, Take medications as prescribed.
